title: 9 of Ukraine deadliest strikes that killed scores of Russians with a single blow US HIMARS and ATACMS take a toll
message:
Some Ukrainian strikes have killed scores of Russian troops with a single blow.
The UK Defense Ministry said on April 27, 2024, that it estimated 450,000 Russian troops had been killed or wounded since the start of the conflict.
The attack killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in one fell swoop, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach islandFootage uploaded by Ukraine of a HIMARS strike on a sandbar.
An unnamed Ukrainian official told the Kyiv Post that it was a "funny situation" because the Russian soldiers had made themselves sitting ducks.
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian strikes kill scores of Russian troops in a single blow
- UK Defense Ministry estimates 450,000 Russian troops killed or wounded since start of conflict
- Attack kills more than 100 Russian soldiers in one fell swoop according to OSINT and military analysts
- Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach island
- Ukraine uploads footage of HIMARS strike on a sandbar
- Unnamed Ukrainian official describes Russian soldiers as sitting ducks

title: Australian police shoot dead  radicalised  teenager after knife attack in Perth
message:
The teenager “rushed” at police who responded by shooting him twice with tasers before firing a single fatal shot, they said.
Western Australian police shot and killed a “radicalised” 16-year-old boy with a knife who stabbed a man in a Perth car park, police and the state premier said on Sunday.
Police body camera images showed the teenager refused officers’ demands that he put down the knife, the police chief said.
03:14 Authorities rule out terrorism in deadly Sydney knife attack Authorities rule out terrorism in deadly Sydney knife attackPolice believe the teenager sent “relevant messages” to some members of the Muslim community who immediately called police, he said, without giving details of the messages.
Two days after the mall attack an Assyrian Christian bishop was brutally stabbed during a live streamed service in western Sydney.
event_breakdown:
- Western Australian police shot and killed a “radicalised” 16-year-old boy with a knife in a Perth car park
- The teenager rushed at police who responded by shooting him twice with tasers before firing a single fatal shot
- Police body camera images showed the teenager refusing officers’ demands to put down the knife
- Authorities ruled out terrorism in deadly Sydney knife attack
- Police believe the teenager sent “relevant messages” to some members of the Muslim community who called the police
- An Assyrian Christian bishop was brutally stabbed during a live streamed service in western Sydney

title: Israeli precision - guided munition likely killed group of children playing foosball in Gaza , weapons experts say
message:
“My soul is gone.”In the two weeks since the attack, the Israeli military’s statements have shifted, but it has not taken responsibility for the strike that ultimately killed Shahed and 10 other children.
An analysis of the site of the attack, documented by a freelance journalist working for CNN in Gaza, paints a very different picture of Israeli military responsibility.
Cobb-Smith said he believed there was “no question” that an Israeli munition was used in the attack, saying Palestinian militants “do not have anything with this amount of sophistication” in their arsenal.
Israeli military’s shifting responseCNN has pressed the Israeli military for details about the strike, which took place on April 16 at about 3:40 p.m., according to video evidence.
The Israeli military declined to provide any additional evidence to back up its claims.
event_breakdown:
- The Israeli military's shifting statements regarding an attack that killed Shahed and 10 other children
- Analysis of the attack site by a freelance journalist suggesting Israeli military responsibility
- Claim by Cobb-Smith that an Israeli munition was used in the attack
- CNN's pressuring of the Israeli military for details about the strike on April 16 at 3:40 p.m.
- Israeli military's refusal to provide additional evidence to support its claims

title: Police in Australia shoot boy dead after stabbing with  hallmark of terrorism
message:
The car park in Perth where the stabbing and shooting occurred - Australian Broadcasting Corporation vi APPolice in Western Australia have shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Perth, in an attack authorities said indicated terrorism.
The apparently random attack, in the car park of a hardware store in the suburb of Willetton, had “hallmarks” of terrorism but was yet to be declared a terrorist act, police said.
State Police Commissioner Col Blanch said when police were called to the car park, the youth lunged at officers with the knife and was shot.
“At this stage it appears that he acted solely and alone,” Western Australia Premier Roger Cook told a televised press conference in Perth, regarding the attacker.
The attack on the bishop came only days after a stabbing spree killed six in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi.
event_breakdown:
1. Stabbing and shooting incident in a car park in Perth, Western Australia
2. Police shoot dead a boy who stabbed a man in Perth
3. Attack with terrorism hallmarks in the suburb of Willetton, Perth
4. State Police Commissioner Col Blanch reports the incident
5. Premier Roger Cook states the attacker acted alone
6. Incident involving a stabbing spree that killed six in Bondi, Sydney

title: Australian police shoot 16 - year - old boy dead after stabbing
message:
Australian police said on Sunday they had shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Western Australia’s capital Perth, in an attack authorities said indicated terrorism.
There were signs the 16-year-old, armed with a kitchen knife, had been radicalized online, state authorities said, adding they received calls from concerned members of the local Muslim community before the attack, which occurred late on Saturday night.
The attack, in the suburb of Willetton, had “hallmarks” of terrorism but was yet to be declared a terrorist act, police said.
“At this stage it appears that he acted solely and alone,” Western Australia Premier Roger Cook told a televised news conference in the state capital Perth, regarding the attacker.
The attack on the bishop came only days after a stabbing spree killed six in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi.
event_breakdown:
- A boy was shot dead by Australian police after he stabbed a man in Willetton, Perth
- The incident had signs of terrorism and the attacker had been radicalized online
- Concerned members of the local Muslim community had called authorities before the attack
- The attack occurred late on Saturday night
- The attacker acted solely and alone according to Western Australia Premier Roger Cook
- The incident was in Western Australia's capital Perth

title: These are the terrorists eliminated near Tulkarem
message:
The IDF and ISA on Saturday night announced the names of the terrorists killed in a nearly 13-hour operation near Tulkarem.
"Over the last few hours, during a joint IDF, ISA, and Israel Police counterterrorism activity, a Hamas terrorist cell was neutralized in the area of Tulkarem," the statement read.
"As part of the counterterrorism activity, the forces located the terrorists in the town of Deir al-Ghusun and engaged in fire, eliminating four terrorists.
"The four terrorists who were eliminated in the area of Tulkarem were:"1.
Tamer Abed Allatif Rajeh Rajeh - a Hamas operative from the town of Shuweika.
event_breakdown:
1. IDF, ISA, and Israel Police announce joint counterterrorism operation near Tulkarem
2. IDF forces locate Hamas terrorist cell in Deir al-Ghusun
3. Four terrorists eliminated in firefight near Tulkarem, including Tamer Abed Allatif Rajeh Rajeh from Shuweika

title: 2 Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civilians
message:
2 Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civiliansBy VOA News May 02, 2024Two Nigerian military officers will face a court martial over a December drone strike that killed at least 85 civilians, the Defense Headquarters said on Thursday.
The Nigerian military acknowledged the drone accidentally struck a village in northwest Kaduna State, killing residents as they celebrated a Muslim festival.
The military depends on aerial assaults to combat Islamic militants in the northeast and armed kidnapping gangs in the northwest.
"The military has conducted a painstaking investigation into the incident and has initiated disciplinary action against those culpable," he said.
The United Nations human rights office said the drone strike was the latest of at least four airstrikes since 2017 that caused significant civilian fatalities.
event_breakdown:
- Two Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civilians in northwest Kaduna State
- Drone strike accidentally struck a village, killing at least 85 civilians during a Muslim festival celebration
- Nigerian military depends on aerial assaults to combat Islamic militants in the northeast and armed kidnapping gangs in the northwest
- Military conducted a painstaking investigation into the incident and initiated disciplinary action against those responsible
- United Nations human rights office highlighted the drone strike as the latest of at least four airstrikes since 2017 causing significant civilian fatalities

title: IDF eliminates top PIJ commander who helped carry out October 7 attacks
message:
A joint attack by the IDF and the Shin Bet (Israel Security Services) killed one of the top commanders of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ), the IDF announced on Saturday.
(credit: IDF SPOKESPERSON'S UNIT)The terrorist, Imam Zerev, was killed by Israel Air Force fighter jets in southern Gaza.
IDF kills Imam Zerev in southern Gaza.
(Credit: IDF Spokesperson's Unit).
Two other terrorists from PIJ were killed in the same air strike.
event_breakdown:
- Joint attack by IDF and Shin Bet kills top PIJ commander Imam Zerev in southern Gaza
- Two other PIJ terrorists also killed in the same air strike

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 04 May 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
Lyman axis: the Ukrainian Defense Forces repelled 7x attacks in the vicinities of Serebryans'ke forestry (Luhansk oblast), Terny (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at more than 10x settlements, including Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka, Tors'ke (Donetsk oblast).
Kherson axis: Russia does not abandon its intention to dislodge Ukrainian troops from their bridgeheads on the left bank of the Dnipro River.
event_breakdown:
- On February 24, 2022, Ukraine was attacked by Russian land, naval, and air forces, sparking the largest European war since World War II.
- Ukrainian Defense Forces repelled 7 attacks near Serebryans'ke forestry (Luhansk oblast) and Terny (Donetsk oblast).
- Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at over 10 settlements, including Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka, and Tors'ke (Donetsk oblast).
- Russia maintains intent to dislodge Ukrainian troops from bridgeheads on the left bank of the Dnipro River.

title: Explosion at DRC displaced person camp kills at least 9
message:
Local officials and media reports in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo say at least nine people – most of them children – were killed Friday following an explosion or explosions at displaced persons camp in the eastern city of Goma.
From his X social media account, DRC journalist Daniel Michombero reported an explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma.
Witnesses and local officials reported seeing at least nine bodies at the scene and at least 20 wounded.
A local hospital official told the French news agency AFP the facility had received 32 wounded and four bodies.
In a statement on his official X account, DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blamed the Rwandan army and its “terrorist auxiliaries” the M23 rebels for the attack.
event_breakdown:
- Explosion(s) reported at displaced persons camp in Goma, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.
- At least nine people, mostly children, killed in the explosion(s).
- Journalist Daniel Michombero reports explosion at Mugunga displaced persons camp.
- Witnesses and local officials observe nine bodies and at least 20 wounded at the scene.
- Local hospital receives 32 wounded and four bodies.
- DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blames Rwandan army and M23 rebels for the attack.

message:

From his X social media account, DRC journalist Daniel Michombero reported an explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma.
Witnesses and local officials reported seeing at least nine bodies at the scene and at least 20 wounded.
A local hospital official told the French news agency AFP the facility had received 32 wounded and four bodies.
In a statement on his official X account, DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blamed the Rwandan army and its “terrorist auxiliaries” the M23 rebels for the attack.

title: Terror strikes IAF convoy in J & K , one soldier dead
message:
The attack occurred near Shashidhar when the convoy vehicles were moving towards Sanai Top in the district's Surankote area.
Five Indian Army personnel including two officers were "killed in action" in the Kalakote forest area of Rajouri on November 22.
Two terrorists, including a top commander of LeT identified as Quari, were also killed in the two-day long gunfight.
Quari was said to be the mastermind behind several attacks, including the killing of 10 civilians and five Army personnel in the district.
In May last year, five more Army personnel were killed and a major-rank officer was injured in Chamrer forest during an anti-terrorist operation.
event_breakdown:
1. Attack near Shashidhar during convoy movement towards Sanai Top in Surankote area
2. Five Indian Army personnel, including two officers, killed in the Kalakote forest area of Rajouri
3. Killing of two terrorists, including LeT top commander Quari, in a two-day gunfight
4. Quari identified as the mastermind behind several attacks, including the deaths of 10 civilians and five Army personnel in the district
5. Previous incident in Chamrer forest resulting in the deaths of five Army personnel and injury to a major-rank officer

title: Journalist , 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote - controlled blast in Khuzdar
message:
Journalist, 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote-controlled blast in KhuzdarRemote-controlled blast was carried out on the Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on National HighwayMohammad Siddiq Mengal car is seen damaged following the blast on May 3, 2024, in this still taken from a video.
KHUZDAR: Mohammad Siddiq Mengal, a journalist and president of the Khuzdar Press Club, was killed along with two others on Friday after a remote-controlled bomb targeted his vehicle in Khuzdar, police told Geo News.
The killed passers-by were seriously injured in the remote-controlled blast and were brought to the hospital, while the other eight injured in the blast are undergoing treatment in different hospitals, police said.
According to the police, the remote-controlled blast was carried out on the Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on the National Highway.
The station house officer said that the journalist's vehicle was the target of the blast and was hit when he was going to university from his home.
event_breakdown:
- Journalist, 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote-controlled blast in Khuzdar
- Remote-controlled blast carried out on Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on National Highway
- Mohammad Siddiq Mengal's car damaged following the blast on May 3, 2024

title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in Rafah : Israeli Army
message:
Jerusalem, May 5: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) announced on Saturday that Aiman Zaarab, a senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, was killed in an airstrike on the southernmost Gazan city of Rafah.
Zaarab directed the Islamic Jihad’s elite forces during the Oct. 7 onslaught on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post bordering the Gaza Strip, said the IDF in a statement.
Zaarab had “commanded and directed” several attacks, and over the past few days, he led the Islamic Jihads’ preparations for a combat in the southern Gaza Strip against the Israeli military, according to the statement.
Along with Zaarab, two other Islamic Jihad operatives were killed during the strike, the IDF added.
event_breakdown:
- Aiman Zaarab, senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, killed in an IDF airstrike in Rafah, southern Gaza
- Zaarab directed Islamic Jihad's elite forces during the Oct. 7 attack on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post bordering Gaza Strip
- IDF states Zaarab had commanded and directed several attacks, recently led Islamic Jihad preparations for combat in southern Gaza against Israeli military
- Two other Islamic Jihad operatives also killed in the strike

title: Eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike near Damascus
message:
Syrian defence ministry claimed on Friday that eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
The Times of Israel citing Syrian state-run broadcaster said the strike caused "material losses."
Israeli warplanes launched their missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site in the area of the capital, the Syrian defence ministry said according to the Syrian Arab News Agency.
Also Russian state media TASS quoted Dubai-based Al Hadath TV as saying that the attack targeted a base of Lebanon's Shia militia, Hezbollah, located southwest of Damascus International Airport.
There was no official confirmation by Israeli authorities on the reported reprisal strike.
event_breakdown:
- Syrian defense ministry claims eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
- The strike caused "material losses," according to Syrian state-run broadcaster cited by The Times of Israel.
- Israeli warplanes launched missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site near the capital, as reported by the Syrian defense ministry via the Syrian Arab News Agency.
- Russian state media TASS quotes Dubai-based Al Hadath TV stating the attack targeted a base of Lebanon's Shia militia, Hezbollah, southwest of Damascus International Airport.
- No official confirmation by Israeli authorities regarding the reported reprisal strike.

title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in Rafah : Israeli army
message:
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) has announced that Aiman Zaarab, a senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, was killed in an airstrike on the southernmost Gazan city of Rafah.
Zaarab directed the Islamic Jihad’s elite forces during the October 7 onslaught on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post bordering the Gaza Strip, the IDF was quoted as saying on Saturday by Xinhua news agency.
Zaarab had “commanded and directed” several attacks, and over the past few days, he led the Islamic Jihads’ preparations for combat in the southern Gaza Strip against the Israeli military, according to the IDF statement.
AdvertisementAlong with Zaarab, two other Islamic Jihad operatives were killed during the strike, the IDF added.
event_breakdown:
- Aiman Zaarab, a senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, was killed in an airstrike on the southernmost Gazan city of Rafah.
- Zaarab directed the Islamic Jihad’s elite forces during the October 7 onslaught on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post bordering the Gaza Strip.
- Two other Islamic Jihad operatives were also killed during the same strike.

title: Moment more than 100 of Putin troops  are wiped out  in long - range strike with newly supplied US ATACMS ballistic missile
message:
This is the moment more than 100 Russian troops are believed to have been killed in an ATACMS tactical ballistic missile strike on occupied Luhansk.
A military training ground was seen being hit by multiple explosions typical of an ATACMS strike in footage captured by a drone flying high above.
Footage of the recent attack appears to show the training ground as one such target.
Over the area where the Russian soldiers were seen seconds earlier, hundreds of flashes of smoke are seen erupting over the clearing.
These flashes, according to analysts, were the M74 APAM mini-bombs detonating on the training ground, killing many of the Russian troops gathered there.
event_breakdown:
- More than 100 Russian troops believed to have been killed in an ATACMS tactical ballistic missile strike on occupied Luhansk.
- Military training ground hit by multiple explosions typical of an ATACMS strike in drone footage.
- Footage of recent attack shows the training ground as a target.
- Hundreds of flashes of smoke seen erupting over the clearing where Russian soldiers were gathered, likely from M74 APAM mini-bombs detonating and killing many troops.

title: N Korea plotting attacks on embassies , Seoul says
message:
N Korea plotting attacks on embassies, Seoul saysAFP, SEOULSouth Korea’s spy agency yesterday said that Pyongyang was plotting “terrorist” attacks targeting Seoul’s officials and citizens overseas, with the South Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs raising the alert level for diplomatic missions in five countries.
North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, right, visits the Pyongyang General Control Center at the State Directorate of Aerospace Technology in Pyongyang on Friday.
As a result, the North may be “plotting retaliation” against South Korean embassy staff on such pretenses, NIS added.
This marked the highest number of defections by North Korean elites to the South since 2017, Seoul said.
The consul, also an intelligence agent, had been monitoring Pyongyang’s illicit activities, including drug trafficking and the production of counterfeit banknotes, according to South Korean reports.
event_breakdown:
- N Korea plotting attacks on embassies, Seoul raises alert level
- North Korean leader Kim Jong-un visits Pyongyang General Control Center
- Increase in number of defections by North Korean elites to South Korea since 2017
- South Korean consul in China monitoring illicit activities by Pyongyang

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 03 May 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at more than 10x settlements, including Makiivka, Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces launched air strikes in the vicinities of Verkhn'okam'yans'ke, Spirne, Ivano-Dar'ivka and New York (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces launched air strikes in the vicinities of Vovche, Kalynove, Zhelanne, Vesele, Novoselivka Persha, Komyshivka, Karlivka (Donetsk oblast).
event_breakdown:
- Ukraine was attacked by land, naval, and air forces of Russia on 24 February 2022
- Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at settlements including Makiivka, Nevs'ke, Terny, Yampolivka in Luhansk and Donetsk oblasts
- Russian forces launched air strikes near Verkhn'okam'yans'ke, Spirne, Ivano-Dar'ivka, and New York in Donetsk oblast
- Russian forces launched air strikes near Vovche, Kalynove, Zhelanne, Vesele, Novoselivka Persha, Komyshivka, Karlivka in Donetsk oblast.

title: Israeli forces kill Hamas gunmen in overnight raid near West Bank Tulkarm
message:
Hamas, the Islamist group which Israel has been fighting in Gaza, had also been building its fighting network in the West Bank before the start of the war.
During the raid, the Israeli army levelled a two-storey house with a bulldozer in an operation that lasted more than 12 hours.
According to Palestinian Health Ministry records, nearly 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces or Jewish settlers in the West Bank or East Jerusalem since Oct. 7.
Palestinians want the West Bank and Gaza, which Israel captured in the 1967 Middle East war, as the core of an independent state with East Jerusalem as its capital.
More than 34,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's seven-month-old assault on the Gaza Strip, say health officials in the Hamas-ruled enclave.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas builds fighting network in the West Bank
- Israeli army levels a two-storey house in the West Bank during a raid
- Nearly 500 Palestinians killed by Israeli forces or Jewish settlers in the West Bank or East Jerusalem since Oct. 7
- Palestinians seek West Bank and Gaza for an independent state with East Jerusalem as its capital
- Over 34,000 Palestinians killed in Israel's assault on the Gaza Strip

title: Rafah offensive and war in Gaza : Threat of a dangerous escalation
message:
Rafah and RegionWithin the region, there is apprehension about the Rafah offensive.
In case of the Rafah offensive going ahead, there is all likelihood that the engagements from Hezbollah into northern Israel will grow.
ConclusionLike the Israeli strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, the Rafah offensive too threatens to escalate the conflict if launched.
While the Iran-Israel spat was short, the Rafah offensive could spread very fast.
The only face-saving exit for either of the parties is an early and long lasting ceasefire in Gaza before any offensive in Rafah.
event_breakdown:
- Apprehension about the Rafah offensive in the region
- Likelihood of increased engagements from Hezbollah into northern Israel if Rafah offensive proceeds
- Threat of escalation of conflict if Rafah offensive is launched
- Potential for rapid spread of conflict with Rafah offensive
- Need for an early and long-lasting ceasefire in Gaza before any offensive in Rafah

title: Australian Muslims claim  double standard  in police handling of hate crime incidents – International Shia News Agency
message:
Shafaqna English- Australian Muslims claim ‘double standard’ in police handling of hate crime incidents, ead of the Australian National Imams Council (ANIC) said.
An April 13 knife attack in a mall in Sydney, Australia killed six people before police killed the attacker.
Days later, Australian police said the attacker had mental health problems that led to the isolated act and that the attack was not related to terrorism.
“One was described as a mental health issue, the other one was labeled a terrorist act.
Emphasizing that the language used by police did not help the situation, Al-Suleiman said they conveyed their concerns about a double standard to authorities but got unsatisfactory feedback.
event_breakdown:
- April 13 knife attack in a mall in Sydney, Australia killed six people before police killed the attacker.
- Australian National Imams Council (ANIC) claimed 'double standard' in police handling of hate crime incidents.
- The attacker in the knife attack was said to have mental health problems leading to an isolated act, not related to terrorism.
- ANIC emphasized concerns about a double standard in police language and received unsatisfactory feedback from authorities.

title: Ukraine wiped out 100 Russian troops at once in a strike showcasing the range and power of its new US ATACMS
message:
Ukrainian forces took out more than 100 Russian soldiers with an ATACMS missile, per OSINT analysts.
AdvertisementA Ukrainian ATACMS long-range missile strike killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Osinttechnical said at least one of the missiles struck a gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets falling on them.
The US had previously sent ATACMS with a shorter range to Ukraine, but the versions sent recently can travel about 190 miles — which puts higher-value targets in Ukraine's crosshairs.
The US sent Ukraine ATACMS with a shorter range last fall, which enabled Ukraine to destroy Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines, but not go after more distant targets.
location: Occupied region 50 miles from the front line
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian forces target Russian soldiers with ATACMS missile, killing over 100 in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line.
- OSINT and military analysts confirm ATACMS strike on gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets deployed.
- Recent versions of ATACMS sent by the US to Ukraine have a range of about 190 miles, allowing for targeting of higher-value distant targets.
- Previous ATACMS sent to Ukraine had a shorter range, enabling destruction of Russian helicopters and airfields behind front lines but not distant targets.

title: Teenagers and terrorism : What is being done ?
message:
AdvertisementNor is the link yet clear between the six charged this week and the church attacker, though one described him as a “mate”.
They had comprised half of ASIO’s “priority counter-terrorism caseload” just a couple of years ago, and “it’s picked up again”, he said.
ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess told the press club that young terror suspects were not a new problem.
Muslim leaders have slammed authorities for not exploring alternatives to the counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last month.
The speed with which police designated the church stabbing a terrorist incident, just hours after it occurred, remains another source of grievance.
event_breakdown:
- The link between the six charged individuals this week and the church attacker is not yet clear, although one referred to him as a “mate”.
- These individuals constituted half of ASIO’s “priority counter-terrorism caseload” a couple of years ago, and according to ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess, this caseload has picked up again.
- Burgess highlighted that young terror suspects are not a new issue.
- Muslim leaders criticize authorities for not exploring alternatives to the counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last month.
- The swift designation of the church stabbing as a terrorist incident by police, just hours after it occurred, remains a source of grievance.

title: Sunday morning news brief , May 05 - The Times of India
message:
08:27 (IST) May 05According to police sources, she was found at a farmhouse in Kalenahalli near Hunsur taluk of Mysuru.
She was taken to Bengaluru for questioning.
The farmhouse where she was found allegedly belongs to Rajagopal, said to be Revanna's personal assistant.

title: Progress in Gaza cease - fire talks , but little chance of ending war
message:
Hamas has called for a complete end to the war and withdrawal of all Israeli forces from Gaza.
A senior Israeli official, speaking on condition of anonymity to discuss ongoing negotiations, played down the prospects for a full end to the war.
Israeli strikes early Saturday on Gaza killed at least six people.
A strike in the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza killed three people, according to hospital officials.
Once inside Gaza, the convoy was commandeered by Hamas terrorists, before UN officials reclaimed it.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas calls for complete end to war and withdrawal of Israeli forces from Gaza
- Israeli official downplays prospects for full end to war
- Israeli strikes in Gaza kill at least six people
- Strike in Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza kills three people
- Convoy entering Gaza is commandeered by Hamas terrorists before being reclaimed by UN officials

title: The US Military China Missile Problem Is Getting Worse
message:
American warships and bases in the Pacific are within reach of an increasingly worrying threat, a daunting missile force unlike any the US has faced in combat before.
With these missiles, China is signaling that it could attack US bases and ships in the region with little to no warning, Clark said.
Department of DefenseThere's a lot more to the Chinese Rocket Force than these weapons, though.
AdvertisementThat said, the US and its allies can't afford to assume the Rocket Force won't be ready should conflict come.
In other words, how the US prepares itself and adapts to the Chinese Rocket Force gives it the best shot at avoiding a fight altogether.
event_breakdown:
- American warships and bases in the Pacific are under threat from China's missile force
- China could potentially launch surprise attacks on US bases and ships in the region
- The Chinese Rocket Force poses a significant challenge for the US and its allies
- The US must be prepared and adapt to the threat posed by the Chinese Rocket Force to avoid conflict.

title: Security forces kill six terrorists in North Waziristan IBO
message:
— AFPSix terrorists were killed by the security forces following an intense gun battle during an intelligence-based operation (IBO) in North Waziristan district, Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said Saturday.
During the conduct of the operation, intense fire exchange took place between the troops and the terrorists, as a result of which six terrorists were "sent to hell".
The killed terrorists remained actively involved in numerous terrorist activities against security forces as well as target killings of innocent civilians in the area.
Security forces on Thursday killed terrorists involved in the recent abduction of district and sessions judge of South Waziristan in a joint IBO in KP's Tank district, the ISPR had said in a statement.
Among the 432 fatalities, 281 included that of civilians and security forces personnel.
event_breakdown:
- Six terrorists killed in intense gun battle during intelligence-based operation (IBO) in North Waziristan district, according to Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR).
- The operation resulted in intense fire exchange between troops and terrorists, leading to the death of six terrorists.
- Killed terrorists were actively involved in terrorist activities against security forces and target killings of civilians in the area.
- Security forces previously killed terrorists involved in the recent abduction of a district and sessions judge of South Waziristan in a joint IBO in KP's Tank district, as stated by the ISPR in a previous statement.
- Among the 432 fatalities, 281 were civilians and security forces personnel.

title: Australian police shoot dead a boy , 16 , armed with a knife after he stabbed a man in Perth – Metro US
message:
A 16-year-old boy armed with a knife was shot dead by police after he stabbed a man in the Australian west coast city of Perth, officials said Sunday.
MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — A 16-year-old boy armed with a knife was shot dead by police after he stabbed a man in the Australian west coast city of Perth, officials said Sunday.
Blanch said members of the local Muslim community had raised concerns with police about the boy’s behavior before he was killed on Saturday.
I also want to commend the local Muslim community who had flagged the individual prior with the police,” Wadood added.
In November 2018, a Somalia-born Muslim stabbed three pedestrians in downtown Melbourne, killing one, before police shot him dead.
event_breakdown:
- A 16-year-old boy armed with a knife was shot dead by police after stabbing a man in Perth, Australian west coast city.
- Members of the local Muslim community had raised concerns about the boy's behavior prior to the incident.
- In November 2018, a Somalia-born Muslim stabbed three pedestrians in downtown Melbourne, killing one, before being shot dead by police.

title: USS Cole Anniversary Today : Media Silent
message:
On this day in the year 2000, the guided missile destroyer USS Cole was attacked by Islamic terrorists associated with Osama bin Laden's al-Quaeda group.
Today is the seventh anniversary of that attack.
The most recent example occured in 1968 when North Korea attacked the USS Pueblo.
Yet not a single media organ seems to care that Americans were attacked and killed.
The USS Pueblo was attacked and captured by North Korea, not North Vietnam.
event_breakdown:
- October 12, 2000: The guided missile destroyer USS Cole was attacked by Islamic terrorists associated with Osama bin Laden's al-Qaeda group.
- Today marks the seventh anniversary of the USS Cole attack.
- In 1968, North Korea attacked and captured the USS Pueblo.
- Despite these attacks on American vessels, there appears to be little media coverage or concern.

title: A Look Inside The Cyberwar Between Israel And Hamas Reveals The Civilian Toll
message:
Gwengoat/iStock / Getty Images PlusThe conflict between Israel and Hamas is happening online as well as on the ground.
The quantity and sophistication of the attacks have made clear that hackers working for the government of Iran , a key Hamas funder and supplier, are supporting Hamas' online warfare.
Before the deadly Oct. 7, 2023 terror attack on Israel that sparked the current war, Hamas cyber operatives were working to support the attack planning .
Hamas' online operations have not been able to offset Israel's military superiority.
As Israel and Hamas volley cyberattacks back and forth, innocent people are caught in the crossfire.
event_breakdown:
1. The conflict between Israel and Hamas is happening online and on the ground.
2. Hackers supported by the government of Iran are aiding Hamas in their online warfare against Israel.
3. Hamas cyber operatives were supporting the attack planning leading up to the deadly Oct. 7, 2023 terror attack on Israel.
4. Hamas' online operations have not been successful in countering Israel's military superiority.
5. Innocent people are caught in the crossfire as Israel and Hamas exchange cyberattacks.

title: Reconstructing Gaza : The International Community Cycle of Impotence The people of Gaza are not going to invite a bullet from Hamas by renouncing them in return for the fool gold of international aid . By Thaddeus G . McCotter
message:
Reconstructing Gaza: The International Community’s Cycle of Impotence The people of Gaza are not going to invite a bullet from Hamas by renouncing them in return for the fool’s gold of international aid.
The international community’s plans—much of them taxpayer subsidized—are expansive, expensive, and will ensure perpetuation of the Hamas terrorists’ cycle of violence against Israel.
And, tragically, this will happen regardless of whether the international community delivers on their promises.
Top pledges came from the United States ($277 million), the European Union ($348 million), Saudi Arabia ($500 million), and Qatar ($1 billion).
Yet, because the international community has overpromised and underperformed time and time again, the people of Gaza are not going to invite a bullet from Hamas by renouncing them in return for the fool’s gold of international aid.
event_breakdown:
1. The people of Gaza are hesitant to renounce Hamas in exchange for international aid due to fear of retaliation.
2. The international community's plans for Gaza are extensive, costly, and may perpetuate the cycle of violence initiated by Hamas against Israel.
3. Despite generous pledges from countries like the United States, European Union, Saudi Arabia, and Qatar, there is skepticism about whether the aid will be delivered effectively.
4. The cycle of overpromising and underperforming by the international community has led to a lack of trust among the people of Gaza regarding renouncing Hamas for aid.

title: Iranian - Made Cruise Missile Crashes in Somalia , No Casualties Reported
message:
TALEEX, Somalia (Horseed Media) – An apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s Sool region late Thursday night, according to witness accounts and visual evidence from the scene, though no casualties have been reported.
Debris an apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s SoolResidents of Taleex district described hearing a loud explosion around midnight, with wreckage discovered in the morning bearing resemblance to an Iranian Quds land-attack cruise missile (LACM).
No group has claimed responsibility for the apparent cruise missile launch violating Somali airspace.
“These actions are taken to protect freedom of navigation and make international waters safer and more secure for US, coalition, and merchant vessels,” CENTCOM said in a statement.
No casualties have been reported in Somalia from the apparent failed cruise missile strike.
event_breakdown:
- An apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia's Sool region
- Debris of the apparent Iranian-made cruise missile found in Taleex district

title: Alleged Israeli Airstrike Injures Eight Syrian Soldiers Near Damascus
message:
Eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an alleged Israeli airstrike on the outskirts of Damascus, according to Syrian state media reports.
The strike, which occurred shortly before 11 p.m., targeted a military position in the Damascus area, as confirmed by the Syrian Defense Ministry.
Syria's state-run SANA broadcaster cited a military source reporting that Israeli warplanes launched missiles from over the Golan Heights in northern Israel, resulting in material losses.
The targeted building, located just south of the Sayyeda Zeinab shrine, was allegedly used by Syrian security forces, according to a security source in the alliance backing Syrian President Bashar Assad’s government.
This strike marks a development since the April 1 incident, where several top Islamic Republic Revolutionary Guard Corps officers were killed in a strike also attributed to Israel.
event_breakdown:
- Eight Syrian soldiers injured in an alleged Israeli airstrike on the outskirts of Damascus
- Strike targeted a military position in the Damascus area
- Strike occurred shortly before 11 p.m.
- Israeli warplanes launched missiles from over the Golan Heights in northern Israel
- Material losses reported at the targeted building
- Building allegedly used by Syrian security forces
- Targeted building located just south of the Sayyeda Zeinab shrine
- Strike seen as a development since the April 1 incident where top Islamic Republic Revolutionary Guard Corps officers were killed in a strike attributed to Israel
